item.title: Valerie add a quote by Jane Austen
item.description: "The person, be it gentleman or lady, who has not pleasure in a good novel, must be intolerably stupid." -- Jane Austen

item.title: Valerie add a quote by Henry James
item.description: "Her reputation for reading a great deal hung about her like the cloudy envelope of a goddess in an epic." -- Henry James

item.title: Valerie add a quote by William Nicholson
item.description: "We read to know we're not alone." -- William Nicholson

item.title: Valerie add a quote by Walter M. Miller Jr.
item.description: "You donâ€™t <i>have</i> a soul, Doctor. You <i>are</i> a soul. You <i>have</i> a body, temporarily." -- Walter M. Miller Jr.

item.title: Valerie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is unnecessary, like philosophy, like art.... It has no survival value; rather it is one of those things which give value to survival." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Valerie add a quote by Robert Fulghum
item.description: "I believe that imagination is stronger than knowledge. That myth is more potent than history. That dreams are more powerful than facts. That hope always triumphs over experience. That laughter is the only cure for grief. And I believe that love is stronger than death." -- Robert Fulghum
